FuncDef:
The raps-mel command sets the value of the maintenance entity group level (MEL) field in R-APS PDUs.
The undo raps-mel command restores the default value of the MEL field. The raps-mel command sets the value of the maintenance entity group level (MEL) field in R-APS PDUs. The undo raps-mel command restores the default value of the MEL field. By default, the value of the MEL field in R-APS PDUs is 7. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the value of the MEL field in R-APS PDUs.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default is 7.

ExtraInfo:
On a Layer 2 network where ERPS is running, if another fault detection protocol is enabled, the MEL field in R-APS PDUs determines whether the R-APS PDUs can be forwarded. If the MEL value in an ERPS ring is smaller than the MEL value of the fault detection protocol, the R-APS PDUs have a lower priority and are discarded. If the MEL value in an ERPS ring is larger than the MEL value of the fault detection protocol, the R-APS PDUs can be forwarded. You can run the raps-mel command to set the value of the MEL field in R-APS PDUs.
In addition, the MEL value can also be used for interworking with other vendors' devices in an ERPS ring. The same MEL value ensures smooth communication between devices.
